statement.tex: %text If $\ora{a}=\vector{1}{1}{1}$ and $\ora{b}=\vector{}{1}{-1}$, find a vector $\ora{c}$ such that $\ora{a}\times \ora{c}=\ora{b}$ and $\ora{a}\cdot \ora{c}=3$ %

reason.tex: \begin{align} z-y=0 &\implies z=y \\ z-x=3 &\implies z=3+x \\ y-z=-1 &\implies y=z-1 \\ x+y+z=0 & \implies x+3+x+3+x=3 \\ &\implies x=\dfrac{3}{2} \\ \therefore x&=\dfrac{3}{2}, y=z=\dfrac{2}{3} \\ \implies \ora{c}&=\dfrac{1}{3}\left(\vector{5}{2}{2}\right) \end{align} \\
